:h[elp] keyword.canonical_description: Opens the help page for the specified keyword in Vim.
aliases: Opens the help page for the specified keyword in Vim.

:sav[eas] file.canonical_description: Saves the current file with the specified file name.
aliases: Saves the current file with the specified file name.

:clo[se].canonical_description: Closes the current pane in Vim.
aliases: Closes the current pane in Vim.

:ter[minal].canonical_description: Opens a terminal window within Vim.
aliases: Opens a terminal window within Vim.

K.canonical_description: Opens the man page for the word currently under the cursor.
aliases: Opens the man page for the word currently under the cursor.

h.canonical_description: Moves the cursor one character to the left.
aliases: Moves the cursor one character to the left.

j.canonical_description: Moves the cursor one line down.
aliases: Moves the cursor one line down.

k.canonical_description: Moves the cursor one line up.
aliases: Moves the cursor one line up.

l.canonical_description: Moves the cursor one character to the right.
aliases: Moves the cursor one character to the right.

gj.canonical_description: Moves the cursor down one line, considering wrapped lines as a single line.
aliases: Moves the cursor down one line, considering wrapped lines as a single line.

gk.canonical_description: Moves the cursor up one line, considering wrapped lines as a single line.
aliases: Moves the cursor up one line, considering wrapped lines as a single line.

H.canonical_description: Moves the cursor to the top of the screen.
aliases: Moves the cursor to the top of the screen.

M.canonical_description: Moves the cursor to the middle of the screen.
aliases: Moves the cursor to the middle of the screen.

L.canonical_description: Moves the cursor to the bottom of the screen.
aliases: Moves the cursor to the bottom of the screen.

w.canonical_description: Moves the cursor forward to the beginning of the next word.
aliases: Moves the cursor forward to the beginning of the next word.

W.canonical_description: Moves the cursor forward to the beginning of the next word, considering punctuation as part of the word.
aliases: Moves the cursor forward to the beginning of the next word, considering punctuation as part of the word.

e.canonical_description: Moves the cursor forward to the end of the current word.
aliases: Moves the cursor forward to the end of the current word.

E.canonical_description: Moves the cursor forward to the end of the current word, considering punctuation as part of the word.
aliases: Moves the cursor forward to the end of the current word, considering punctuation as part of the word.

b.canonical_description: Moves the cursor backward to the beginning of the previous word.
aliases: Moves the cursor backward to the beginning of the previous word.

B.canonical_description: Moves the cursor backward to the beginning of the previous word, considering punctuation as part of the word.
aliases: Moves the cursor backward to the beginning of the previous word, considering punctuation as part of the word.

ge.canonical_description: Moves the cursor backward to the end of the previous word.
aliases: Moves the cursor backward to the end of the previous word.

gE.canonical_description: Moves the cursor backward to the end of the previous word, considering punctuation as part of the word.
aliases: Moves the cursor backward to the end of the previous word, considering punctuation as part of the word.

%.canonical_description: Moves the cursor to the matching character of a pair, such as parentheses, brackets, or braces. Use :h matchpairs in Vim for more information on supported pairs.
aliases: Moves the cursor to the matching character of a pair, such as parentheses, brackets, or braces. Use :h matchpairs in Vim for more information on supported pairs.

0.canonical_description: Moves the cursor to the very beginning of the current line.
aliases: Moves the cursor to the very beginning of the current line.

^.canonical_description: Moves the cursor to the first non-blank character on the current line.
aliases: Moves the cursor to the first non-blank character on the current line.

$.canonical_description: Moves the cursor to the end of the current line.
aliases: Moves the cursor to the end of the current line.

g_.canonical_description: Moves the cursor to the last non-blank character on the current line.
aliases: Moves the cursor to the last non-blank character on the current line.

gg.canonical_description: Moves the cursor to the first line of the document.
aliases: Moves the cursor to the first line of the document.

G.canonical_description: Moves the cursor to the last line of the document.
aliases: Moves the cursor to the last line of the document.

5gg or 5G.canonical_description: Moves the cursor to line number 5 in the document.
aliases: Moves the cursor to line number 5 in the document.

gd.canonical_description: Moves the cursor to the local declaration of the variable under the cursor (useful for code editing).
aliases: Moves the cursor to the local declaration of the variable under the cursor (useful for code editing).

gD.canonical_description: Moves the cursor to the global declaration of the variable under the cursor (useful for code editing).
aliases: Moves the cursor to the global declaration of the variable under the cursor (useful for code editing).

fx.canonical_description: Moves the cursor to the next occurrence of character 'x' on the current line.
aliases: Moves the cursor to the next occurrence of character 'x' on the current line.

tx.canonical_description: Moves the cursor to the position before the next occurrence of character 'x' on the current line.
aliases: Moves the cursor to the position before the next occurrence of character 'x' on the current line.

Fx.canonical_description: Moves the cursor to the previous occurrence of character 'x' on the current line.
aliases: Moves the cursor to the previous occurrence of character 'x' on the current line.

Tx.canonical_description: Moves the cursor to the position after the previous occurrence of character 'x' on the current line.
aliases: Moves the cursor to the position after the previous occurrence of character 'x' on the current line.

;.canonical_description: Repeats the previous f, t, F, or T cursor movement command in the same direction.
aliases: Repeats the previous f, t, F, or T cursor movement command in the same direction.

,.canonical_description: Repeats the previous f, t, F, or T cursor movement command in the opposite direction.
aliases: Repeats the previous f, t, F, or T cursor movement command in the opposite direction.

}.canonical_description: Moves the cursor to the beginning of the next paragraph. When editing code, it moves to the next function or block.
aliases: Moves the cursor to the beginning of the next paragraph. When editing code, it moves to the next function or block.

{.canonical_description: Moves the cursor to the beginning of the previous paragraph. When editing code, it moves to the previous function or block.
aliases: Moves the cursor to the beginning of the previous paragraph. When editing code, it moves to the previous function or block.

zz.canonical_description: Centers the cursor vertically on the screen.
aliases: Centers the cursor vertically on the screen.

zt.canonical_description: Positions the cursor at the top of the screen.
aliases: Positions the cursor at the top of the screen.

zb.canonical_description: Positions the cursor at the bottom of the screen.
aliases: Positions the cursor at the bottom of the screen.

Ctrl + e.canonical_description: Scrolls the screen down one line without moving the cursor.
aliases: Scrolls the screen down one line without moving the cursor.

Ctrl + y.canonical_description: Scrolls the screen up one line without moving the cursor.
aliases: Scrolls the screen up one line without moving the cursor.

Ctrl + b.canonical_description: Scrolls the screen up one page and moves the cursor to the last line of the new page.
aliases: Scrolls the screen up one page and moves the cursor to the last line of the new page.

Ctrl + f.canonical_description: Scrolls the screen down one page and moves the cursor to the first line of the new page.
aliases: Scrolls the screen down one page and moves the cursor to the first line of the new page.

Ctrl + d.canonical_description: De-indents the current line one shiftwidth to the left while in insert mode.
aliases: De-indents the current line one shiftwidth to the left while in insert mode.

Ctrl + u.canonical_description: Scrolls the screen up half a page and moves the cursor accordingly.
aliases: Scrolls the screen up half a page and moves the cursor accordingly.

i.canonical_description: Enters insert mode and starts inserting text before the cursor position.
aliases: Enters insert mode and starts inserting text before the cursor position.

I.canonical_description: Enters insert mode and starts inserting text at the beginning of the current line.
aliases: Enters insert mode and starts inserting text at the beginning of the current line.

a.canonical_description: Enters insert mode and starts inserting text after the cursor position.
aliases: Enters insert mode and starts inserting text after the cursor position.

A.canonical_description: Enters insert mode and starts inserting text at the end of the current line.
aliases: Enters insert mode and starts inserting text at the end of the current line.

o.canonical_description: While in visual mode, this command moves the cursor to the opposite end of the currently selected area.
aliases: While in visual mode, this command moves the cursor to the opposite end of the currently selected area.

O.canonical_description: While in visual block mode, this command moves the cursor to the opposite corner of the selected block.
aliases: While in visual block mode, this command moves the cursor to the opposite corner of the selected block.

ea.canonical_description: Moves the cursor to the end of the current word and enters insert mode.
aliases: Moves the cursor to the end of the current word and enters insert mode.

Ctrl + h.canonical_description: Deletes the character before the cursor while in insert mode.
aliases: Deletes the character before the cursor while in insert mode.

Ctrl + w.canonical_description: Deletes the word before the cursor while in insert mode.
aliases: Deletes the word before the cursor while in insert mode.

Ctrl + j.canonical_description: Inserts a line break at the current cursor position while in insert mode.
aliases: Inserts a line break at the current cursor position while in insert mode.

Ctrl + t.canonical_description: Indents the current line one shiftwidth to the right while in insert mode.
aliases: Indents the current line one shiftwidth to the right while in insert mode.

Ctrl + n.canonical_description: Inserts the next matching completion before the cursor while in insert mode.
aliases: Inserts the next matching completion before the cursor while in insert mode.

Ctrl + p.canonical_description: Inserts the previous matching completion before the cursor while in insert mode.
aliases: Inserts the previous matching completion before the cursor while in insert mode.

Ctrl + rx.canonical_description: Inserts the contents of register 'x' at the cursor position.
aliases: Inserts the contents of register 'x' at the cursor position.

Ctrl + ox.canonical_description: Temporarily switches to normal mode from insert mode to execute a single normal mode command 'x'. After executing the command, it returns to insert mode.
aliases: Temporarily switches to normal mode from insert mode to execute a single normal mode command 'x'. After executing the command, it returns to insert mode.
Exits visual mode.

r.canonical_description: Replaces the character under the cursor with the next character typed.
aliases: Replaces the character under the cursor with the next character typed.

R.canonical_description: Enters replace mode, allowing you to replace multiple characters until the ESC key is pressed.
aliases: Enters replace mode, allowing you to replace multiple characters until the ESC key is pressed.

J.canonical_description: Joins the line below the current line to the end of the current line, adding a single space in between.
aliases: Joins the line below the current line to the end of the current line, adding a single space in between.

gJ.canonical_description: Joins the line below the current line to the end of the current line without adding any space.
aliases: Joins the line below the current line to the end of the current line without adding any space.

gwip.canonical_description: Reflows the current paragraph, adjusting line breaks to fit within the current window width.
aliases: Reflows the current paragraph, adjusting line breaks to fit within the current window width.

g~.canonical_description: Switches the case of characters (uppercase to lowercase or vice versa) from the cursor position to the end of the specified motion.
aliases: Switches the case of characters (uppercase to lowercase or vice versa) from the cursor position to the end of the specified motion.

gu.canonical_description: Changes the characters from the cursor position to the end of the specified motion to lowercase.
aliases: Changes the characters from the cursor position to the end of the specified motion to lowercase.

gU.canonical_description: Changes text to uppercase up to the specified motion.
aliases: Changes text to uppercase up to the specified motion.

cc.canonical_description: Replaces the content of the entire current line.
aliases: Replaces the content of the entire current line.

c$ or C.canonical_description: Replaces text from the cursor position to the end of the current line.
aliases: Replaces text from the cursor position to the end of the current line.

ciw.canonical_description: Replaces the entire word under the cursor.
aliases: Replaces the entire word under the cursor.

cw or ce.canonical_description: Replaces text from the cursor position to the end of the current word.
aliases: Replaces text from the cursor position to the end of the current word.

s.canonical_description: Deletes the character under the cursor and enters insert mode to allow substitution of text (same as cl).
aliases: Deletes the character under the cursor and enters insert mode to allow substitution of text (same as cl).

S.canonical_description: Deletes the entire line and enters insert mode to allow substitution of text (same as cc).
aliases: Deletes the entire line and enters insert mode to allow substitution of text (same as cc).

xp.canonical_description: Transposes the character under the cursor with the character to its right (effectively deleting and pasting).
aliases: Transposes the character under the cursor with the character to its right (effectively deleting and pasting).

u.canonical_description: In visual mode, changes the selected text to lowercase.
aliases: In visual mode, changes the selected text to lowercase.

U.canonical_description: In visual mode, changes the selected text to uppercase.
aliases: In visual mode, changes the selected text to uppercase.
Redoes a previously undone change.
Repeats the last executed command.

v.canonical_description: Starts visual mode, allowing you to select text by moving the cursor. Once text is selected, you can perform various commands on it (like yanking/copying).
aliases: Starts visual mode, allowing you to select text by moving the cursor. Once text is selected, you can perform various commands on it (like yanking/copying).

V.canonical_description: Starts linewise visual mode, which allows you to select entire lines by moving the cursor.
aliases: Starts linewise visual mode, which allows you to select entire lines by moving the cursor.

Ctrl + v.canonical_description: Starts visual block mode, allowing you to select a rectangular block of text.
aliases: Starts visual block mode, allowing you to select a rectangular block of text.

aw.canonical_description: In visual mode, selects the current word.
aliases: In visual mode, selects the current word.

ab.canonical_description: In visual mode, selects a block of text enclosed by parentheses ().
aliases: In visual mode, selects a block of text enclosed by parentheses ().

aB.canonical_description: In visual mode, selects a block of text enclosed by curly braces {}.
aliases: In visual mode, selects a block of text enclosed by curly braces {}.

at.canonical_description: In visual mode, selects a block of text enclosed by angle brackets <> (often used for tags).
aliases: In visual mode, selects a block of text enclosed by angle brackets <> (often used for tags).

ib.canonical_description: In visual mode, selects the text within the nearest enclosing parentheses ().
aliases: In visual mode, selects the text within the nearest enclosing parentheses ().

iB.canonical_description: In visual mode, selects the text within the nearest enclosing curly braces {}.
aliases: In visual mode, selects the text within the nearest enclosing curly braces {}.

it.canonical_description: In visual mode, selects the text within the nearest enclosing angle brackets <> (often used for tags).
aliases: In visual mode, selects the text within the nearest enclosing angle brackets <> (often used for tags).

>.canonical_description: In visual mode, shifts the selected text one indentation level to the right.
aliases: In visual mode, shifts the selected text one indentation level to the right.

<.canonical_description: In visual mode, shifts the selected text one indentation level to the left.
aliases: In visual mode, shifts the selected text one indentation level to the left.

y.canonical_description: In visual mode, copies (yanks) the selected text into the clipboard.
aliases: In visual mode, copies (yanks) the selected text into the clipboard.

d.canonical_description: In visual mode, deletes the selected text.
aliases: In visual mode, deletes the selected text.

~.canonical_description: In visual mode, switches the case (uppercase/lowercase) of the selected text.
aliases: In visual mode, switches the case (uppercase/lowercase) of the selected text.

:reg[isters].canonical_description: Displays the contents of all registers.
aliases: Displays the contents of all registers.

\"xy.canonical_description: Copies (yanks) the selected text into the specified register x.
aliases: Copies (yanks) the selected text into the specified register x.

\"xp.canonical_description: Pastes the contents of the specified register x.
aliases: Pastes the contents of the specified register x.

\"+y.canonical_description: Copies (yanks) the selected text into the system clipboard.
aliases: Copies (yanks) the selected text into the system clipboard.

\"+p.canonical_description: Pastes the contents of the system clipboard.
aliases: Pastes the contents of the system clipboard.

:marks.canonical_description: Displays a list of all saved marks.
aliases: Displays a list of all saved marks.

ma.canonical_description: Sets the current cursor position as mark A. You can use any letter for the mark name.
aliases: Sets the current cursor position as mark A. You can use any letter for the mark name.

`a.canonical_description: Moves the cursor to the position marked as A.
aliases: Moves the cursor to the position marked as A.

y`a.canonical_description: Copies (yanks) the selected text and places it at the position marked as A.
aliases: Copies (yanks) the selected text and places it at the position marked as A.

`0.canonical_description: Moves the cursor to the position where Vim was last exited.
aliases: Moves the cursor to the position where Vim was last exited.

'\".canonical_description: Moves the cursor to the position when you last edited this file.
aliases: Moves the cursor to the position when you last edited this file.

`.`.canonical_description: Moves the cursor to the position of the last change in this file.
aliases: Moves the cursor to the position of the last change in this file.

``.canonical_description: Moves the cursor to the position before the last jump.
aliases: Moves the cursor to the position before the last jump.

:ju[mps].canonical_description: Displays a list of all recent jumps.
aliases: Displays a list of all recent jumps.

Ctrl + i.canonical_description: Moves the cursor to the next newer position in the jump list.
aliases: Moves the cursor to the next newer position in the jump list.

Ctrl + o.canonical_description: Moves the cursor to the next older position in the jump list.
aliases: Moves the cursor to the next older position in the jump list.

:changes.canonical_description: Displays a list of all recent changes made in the buffer.
aliases: Displays a list of all recent changes made in the buffer.

g,.canonical_description: Moves the cursor to the next newer position in the change list.
aliases: Moves the cursor to the next newer position in the change list.

g;.canonical_description: Moves the cursor to the next older position in the change list.
aliases: Moves the cursor to the next older position in the change list.

Ctrl + ].canonical_description: Jumps to the definition of the tag under the cursor.
aliases: Jumps to the definition of the tag under the cursor.

qa.canonical_description: Starts recording a macro and saves it in register 'a'.
aliases: Starts recording a macro and saves it in register 'a'.
Stops recording the current macro.

@a.canonical_description: Executes the macro stored in register 'a'.
aliases: Executes the macro stored in register 'a'.
Repeats the last executed macro.

yy.canonical_description: Copies the current line into the default register (").
aliases: Copies the current line into the default register (").

2yy.canonical_description: Copies the current line and the next line into the default register (").
aliases: Copies the current line and the next line into the default register (").

yw.canonical_description: Copies the characters of the word from the cursor position to the start of the next word into the default register (").
aliases: Copies the characters of the word from the cursor position to the start of the next word into the default register (").

yiw.canonical_description: Copies the word under the cursor into the default register (").
aliases: Copies the word under the cursor into the default register (").

yaw.canonical_description: Copies the word under the cursor and the space after or before it into the default register (").
aliases: Copies the word under the cursor and the space after or before it into the default register (").

y$ or Y.canonical_description: Copies the characters from the cursor position to the end of the line into the default register (").
aliases: Copies the characters from the cursor position to the end of the line into the default register (").

p.canonical_description: Pastes the contents of the default register (") after the cursor.
aliases: Pastes the contents of the default register (") after the cursor.

P.canonical_description: Pastes the contents of the default register (") before the cursor.
aliases: Pastes the contents of the default register (") before the cursor.

gp.canonical_description: Pastes the contents of the default register (") after the cursor and leaves the cursor after the new text.
aliases: Pastes the contents of the default register (") after the cursor and leaves the cursor after the new text.

gP.canonical_description: Pastes the contents of the default register (") before the cursor and leaves the cursor after the new text.
aliases: Pastes the contents of the default register (") before the cursor and leaves the cursor after the new text.

dd.canonical_description: Deletes the current line and places it in the default register (").
aliases: Deletes the current line and places it in the default register (").

2dd.canonical_description: Deletes the current line and the next line and places them in the default register (").
aliases: Deletes the current line and the next line and places them in the default register (").

dw.canonical_description: Deletes the characters of the word from the cursor position to the start of the next word and places them in the default register (").
aliases: Deletes the characters of the word from the cursor position to the start of the next word and places them in the default register (").

diw.canonical_description: Deletes the word under the cursor and places it in the default register (").
aliases: Deletes the word under the cursor and places it in the default register (").

daw.canonical_description: Deletes the word under the cursor and the space after or before it and places it in the default register (").
aliases: Deletes the word under the cursor and the space after or before it and places it in the default register (").
Deletes lines 3 through 5.

d$ or D.canonical_description: Deletes the characters from the cursor position to the end of the line and places them in the default register (").
aliases: Deletes the characters from the cursor position to the end of the line and places them in the default register (").

x.canonical_description: Deletes the character under the cursor and places it in the default register (").
aliases: Deletes the character under the cursor and places it in the default register (").

>>.canonical_description: Indents the current line one shiftwidth to the right.
aliases: Indents the current line one shiftwidth to the right.

<<.canonical_description: De-indents the current line one shiftwidth to the left.
aliases: De-indents the current line one shiftwidth to the left.

>%.canonical_description: Indents a block enclosed by parentheses () or curly brackets {}, with the cursor positioned on the opening or closing brace.
aliases: Indents a block enclosed by parentheses () or curly brackets {}, with the cursor positioned on the opening or closing brace.

<%.canonical_description: De-indents a block enclosed by parentheses () or curly brackets {}, with the cursor positioned on the opening or closing brace.
aliases: De-indents a block enclosed by parentheses () or curly brackets {}, with the cursor positioned on the opening or closing brace.

>ib.canonical_description: Indents the inner block enclosed by parentheses ().
aliases: Indents the inner block enclosed by parentheses ().

>at.canonical_description: Indents a block enclosed by angle brackets <> (tags).
aliases: Indents a block enclosed by angle brackets <> (tags).

3==.canonical_description: Re-indents the current line and the two lines below it.
aliases: Re-indents the current line and the two lines below it.

=%.canonical_description: Re-indents a block enclosed by parentheses () or curly brackets {}, with the cursor positioned on the opening or closing brace.
aliases: Re-indents a block enclosed by parentheses () or curly brackets {}, with the cursor positioned on the opening or closing brace.

=iB.canonical_description: Re-indents the inner block enclosed by curly brackets {}.
aliases: Re-indents the inner block enclosed by curly brackets {}.

gg=G.canonical_description: Re-indents the entire buffer (all lines in the current file).
aliases: Re-indents the entire buffer (all lines in the current file).

]p.canonical_description: Pastes the contents of the default register (") and adjusts the indentation to match the current line.
aliases: Pastes the contents of the default register (") and adjusts the indentation to match the current line.

:w.canonical_description: Saves the current file without exiting Vim.
aliases: Saves the current file without exiting Vim.

:w !sudo tee %.canonical_description: Saves the current file using sudo (superuser privileges). This is useful when you don't have write permissions to the file.
aliases: Saves the current file using sudo (superuser privileges). This is useful when you don't have write permissions to the file.

:wq or :x or ZZ.canonical_description: Saves the current file and exits Vim.
aliases: Saves the current file and exits Vim.

:q.canonical_description: Exits Vim. Fails if there are unsaved changes.
aliases: Exits Vim. Fails if there are unsaved changes.

:q! or ZQ.canonical_description: Exits Vim and discards any unsaved changes.
aliases: Exits Vim and discards any unsaved changes.

:wqa.canonical_description: Saves all open files and exits Vim.
aliases: Saves all open files and exits Vim.

/pattern.canonical_description: Searches forward for the specified pattern.
aliases: Searches forward for the specified pattern.

?pattern.canonical_description: Searches backward for the specified pattern.
aliases: Searches backward for the specified pattern.

\\vpattern.canonical_description: Searches for the specified pattern using 'very magic' mode, where non-alphanumeric characters are interpreted as special regex symbols without escaping.
aliases: Searches for the specified pattern using 'very magic' mode, where non-alphanumeric characters are interpreted as special regex symbols without escaping.

n.canonical_description: Repeats the last search in the same direction (forward).
aliases: Repeats the last search in the same direction (forward).

N.canonical_description: Repeats the last search in the opposite direction (backward).
aliases: Repeats the last search in the opposite direction (backward).

:%s/old/new/g.canonical_description: Replaces all occurrences of 'old' with 'new' throughout the entire file.
aliases: Replaces all occurrences of 'old' with 'new' throughout the entire file.

:%s/old/new/gc.canonical_description: Replaces all occurrences of 'old' with 'new' throughout the entire file, prompting for confirmation before each replacement.
aliases: Replaces all occurrences of 'old' with 'new' throughout the entire file, prompting for confirmation before each replacement.

:noh[lsearch].canonical_description: Removes the highlighting of search matches.
aliases: Removes the highlighting of search matches.

:vim[grep] /pattern/ {`{file}`}.canonical_description: Searches for a given pattern in multiple files.
aliases: Searches for a given pattern in multiple files.

:cn[ext].canonical_description: Jumps to the next match from a previous search.
aliases: Jumps to the next match from a previous search.

:cp[revious].canonical_description: Jumps to the previous match from a previous search.
aliases: Jumps to the previous match from a previous search.

:cope[n].canonical_description: Opens a window that displays a list of matches from the previous search.
aliases: Opens a window that displays a list of matches from the previous search.

:ccl[ose].canonical_description: Closes the quickfix window, which contains the list of search results.
aliases: Closes the quickfix window, which contains the list of search results.

:tabnew or :tabnew {page.words.file}.canonical_description: Opens a new tab, optionally with a specified file.
aliases: Opens a new tab, optionally with a specified file.

Ctrl + wT.canonical_description: Moves the currently active split window into its own new tab.
aliases: Moves the currently active split window into its own new tab.
Navigates to the next tab.
Navigates to the previous tab.

#gt.canonical_description: Moves to the tab specified by the number #.
aliases: Moves to the tab specified by the number #.

:tabm[ove] #.canonical_description: Moves the current tab to the position specified by the number # (indexed from 0).
aliases: Moves the current tab to the position specified by the number # (indexed from 0).

:tabc[lose].canonical_description: Closes the current tab and all its associated windows.
aliases: Closes the current tab and all its associated windows.

:tabo[nly].canonical_description: Closes all tabs except the currently active tab.
aliases: Closes all tabs except the currently active tab.

:tabdo command.canonical_description: Runs the specified command on all open tabs.
aliases: Runs the specified command on all open tabs.

:e[dit] file.canonical_description: Opens a specified file for editing in a new buffer.
aliases: Opens a specified file for editing in a new buffer.
Switches to the next buffer.
Switches to the previous buffer.

:bd[elete].canonical_description: Deletes a specified buffer, which effectively closes the associated file.
aliases: Deletes a specified buffer, which effectively closes the associated file.

:b[uffer]#.canonical_description: Switches to the buffer identified by its index number.
aliases: Switches to the buffer identified by its index number.

:b[uffer] file.canonical_description: Switches to the buffer associated with the specified file name.
aliases: Switches to the buffer associated with the specified file name.

:ls or :buffers.canonical_description: Displays a list of all currently open buffers.
aliases: Displays a list of all currently open buffers.

:sp[lit] file.canonical_description: Opens a specified file in a new buffer and splits the window horizontally to display it.
aliases: Opens a specified file in a new buffer and splits the window horizontally to display it.

:vs[plit] file.canonical_description: Opens a specified file in a new buffer and splits the window vertically to display it.
aliases: Opens a specified file in a new buffer and splits the window vertically to display it.

:vert[ical] ba[ll].canonical_description: Arranges all open buffers as vertical windows.
aliases: Arranges all open buffers as vertical windows.

:tab ba[ll].canonical_description: Opens all open buffers in separate tabs.
aliases: Opens all open buffers in separate tabs.

Ctrl + ws.canonical_description: Splits the current window horizontally, creating a new split.
aliases: Splits the current window horizontally, creating a new split.

Ctrl + wv.canonical_description: Splits the current window vertically, creating a new split.
aliases: Splits the current window vertically, creating a new split.

Ctrl + ww.canonical_description: Switches the focus to the next window within the current split arrangement.
aliases: Switches the focus to the next window within the current split arrangement.

Ctrl + wq.canonical_description: Closes the currently active window within a split arrangement.
aliases: Closes the currently active window within a split arrangement.

Ctrl + wx.canonical_description: Exchanges the position of the current window with the next one in the split arrangement.
aliases: Exchanges the position of the current window with the next one in the split arrangement.

Ctrl + w=.canonical_description: Resizes all windows in the current split arrangement to have equal height and width.
aliases: Resizes all windows in the current split arrangement to have equal height and width.

Ctrl + wh.canonical_description: Moves the cursor to the window located to the left in a vertical split arrangement.
aliases: Moves the cursor to the window located to the left in a vertical split arrangement.

Ctrl + wl.canonical_description: Moves the cursor to the window located to the right in a vertical split arrangement.
aliases: Moves the cursor to the window located to the right in a vertical split arrangement.

Ctrl + wj.canonical_description: Moves the cursor to the window located below in a horizontal split arrangement.
aliases: Moves the cursor to the window located below in a horizontal split arrangement.

Ctrl + wk.canonical_description: Moves the cursor to the window located above in a horizontal split arrangement.
aliases: Moves the cursor to the window located above in a horizontal split arrangement.

Ctrl + wH.canonical_description: Makes the current window occupy the full height of the screen and positions it as the leftmost window in a vertical split arrangement.
aliases: Makes the current window occupy the full height of the screen and positions it as the leftmost window in a vertical split arrangement.

Ctrl + wL.canonical_description: Makes the current window occupy the full height of the screen and positions it as the rightmost window in a vertical split arrangement.
aliases: Makes the current window occupy the full height of the screen and positions it as the rightmost window in a vertical split arrangement.

Ctrl + wJ.canonical_description: Makes the current window occupy the full width of the screen and positions it as the bottommost window in a horizontal split arrangement.
aliases: Makes the current window occupy the full width of the screen and positions it as the bottommost window in a horizontal split arrangement.

Ctrl + wK.canonical_description: Makes the current window occupy the full width of the screen and positions it as the topmost window in a horizontal split arrangement.
aliases: Makes the current window occupy the full width of the screen and positions it as the topmost window in a horizontal split arrangement.

zf.canonical_description: Manually defines a code fold from the current cursor position up to the specified motion.
aliases: Manually defines a code fold from the current cursor position up to the specified motion.

zd.canonical_description: Deletes the code fold located under the cursor.
aliases: Deletes the code fold located under the cursor.

za.canonical_description: Toggles the open/closed state of the code fold located under the cursor.
aliases: Toggles the open/closed state of the code fold located under the cursor.

zo.canonical_description: Opens (expands) the code fold located under the cursor.
aliases: Opens (expands) the code fold located under the cursor.

zc.canonical_description: Closes (collapses) the code fold located under the cursor.
aliases: Closes (collapses) the code fold located under the cursor.

zr.canonical_description: Reduces the folding level by one, effectively opening folds at the outermost level.
aliases: Reduces the folding level by one, effectively opening folds at the outermost level.

zm.canonical_description: Increases the folding level by one, effectively closing folds at the current level.
aliases: Increases the folding level by one, effectively closing folds at the current level.

zi.canonical_description: Toggles the folding functionality on or off.
aliases: Toggles the folding functionality on or off.

]c.canonical_description: Jumps to the start of the next change in the document.
aliases: Jumps to the start of the next change in the document.

[c.canonical_description: Jumps to the start of the previous change in the document.
aliases: Jumps to the start of the previous change in the document.

do or :diffg[et].canonical_description: Obtains (gets) the difference from another buffer and applies it to the current buffer.
aliases: Obtains (gets) the difference from another buffer and applies it to the current buffer.

dp or :diffpu[t].canonical_description: Puts (applies) the difference from the current buffer to another buffer.
aliases: Puts (applies) the difference from the current buffer to another buffer.

:diffthis.canonical_description: Marks the current window as part of the diff comparison.
aliases: Marks the current window as part of the diff comparison.

:dif[fupdate].canonical_description: Updates the displayed differences between buffers in diff mode.
aliases: Updates the displayed differences between buffers in diff mode.

:diffo[ff].canonical_description: Disables diff mode for the current window.
aliases: Disables diff mode for the current window.
